     335                 :          0 :     std::optional<bool> MatchesBlock(const uint256& block_hash) const

     337                 :          0 :         return m_wallet.chain().blockFilterMatchesAny(BlockFilterType::BASIC, block_hash, m_filter_set);
     338                 :            :     }
     339                 :            : 
     340                 :            : private:
     341                 :            :     const CWallet& m_wallet;
     342                 :            :     /** Map for keeping track of each range descriptor's last seen end range.
     343                 :            :       * This information is used to detect whether new addresses were derived
     344                 :            :       * (that is, if the current end range is larger than the saved end range)
     345                 :            :       * after processing a block and hence a filter set update is needed to
     346                 :            :       * take possible keypool top-ups into account.
     347                 :            :       */
     348                 :            :     std::map<uint256, int32_t> m_last_range_ends;
     349                 :            :     GCSFilter::ElementSet m_filter_set;

     704                 :            : {
     705                 :            :     // We want all the wallet transactions in range to have the same metadata as

     707                 :            :     // So: find smallest nOrderPos:
     708                 :            :

    1330                 :          0 : void CWallet::MarkConflicted(const uint256& hashBlock, int conflicting_height, const uint256& hashTx)

    1337                 :            :     // case.

    1423                 :     113862 : void CWallet::transactionRemovedFromMempool(const CTransactionRef& tx, MemPoolRemovalReason reason) {
    1424                 :     113862 :     LOCK(cs_wallet);
    1425   [ +  -  +  -  :     113862 :     auto it = mapWallet.find(tx->GetHash());
                   +  - ]
    1426         [ +  + ]:     113862 :     if (it != mapWallet.end()) {
    1427   [ +  -  +  - ]:      84681 :         RefreshMempoolStatus(it->second, chain());
    1428                 :      84681 :     }
    1429                 :            :     // Handle transactions that were removed from the mempool because they
    1430                 :            :     // conflict with transactions in a newly connected block.
    1431         [ +  - ]:     113862 :     if (reason == MemPoolRemovalReason::CONFLICT) {
    1432                 :            :         // Trigger external -walletnotify notifications for these transactions.
    1433                 :            :         // Set Status::UNCONFIRMED instead of Status::CONFLICTED for a few reasons:
    1434                 :            :         //
    1435                 :            :         // 1. The transactionRemovedFromMempool callback does not currently
    1436                 :            :         //    provide the conflicting block's hash and height, and for backwards
    1437                 :            :         //    compatibility reasons it may not be not safe to store conflicted
    1438                 :            :         //    wallet transactions with a null block hash. See
    1439                 :            :         //    https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18600#discussion_r420195993.
    1440                 :            :         // 2. For most of these transactions, the wallet's internal conflict
    1441                 :            :         //    detection in the blockConnected handler will subsequently call
    1442                 :            :         //    MarkConflicted and update them with CONFLICTED status anyway. This
    1443                 :            :         //    applies to any wallet transaction that has inputs spent in the
    1444                 :            :         //    block, or that has ancestors in the wallet with inputs spent by
    1445                 :            :         //    the block.
    1446                 :            :         // 3. Longstanding behavior since the sync implementation in
    1447                 :            :         //    https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9371 and the prior sync
    1448                 :            :         //    implementation before that was to mark these transactions
    1449                 :            :         //    unconfirmed rather than conflicted.
    1450                 :            :         //
    1451                 :            :         // Nothing described above should be seen as an unchangeable requirement
    1452                 :            :         // when improving this code in the future. The wallet's heuristics for
    1453                 :            :         // distinguishing between conflicted and unconfirmed transactions are
    1454                 :            :         // imperfect, and could be improved in general, see
    1455                 :            :         // https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/Wallet-Transaction-Conflict-Tracking
    1456   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         SyncTransaction(tx, TxStateInactive{});
    1457                 :          0 :     }
    1458                 :     113862 : }
    1459                 :            : 
    1460                 :      23806 : void CWallet::blockConnected(ChainstateRole role, const interfaces::BlockInfo& block)
    1461                 :            : {
    1462         [ -  + ]:      23806 :     if (role == ChainstateRole::BACKGROUND) {
    1463                 :          0 :         return;
    1464                 :            :     }
    1465         [ +  - ]:      23806 :     assert(block.data);
    1466                 :      23806 :     LOCK(cs_wallet);
    1467                 :            : 
    1468                 :      23806 :     m_last_block_processed_height = block.height;
    1469                 :      23806 :     m_last_block_processed = block.hash;
    1470                 :            : 
    1471                 :            :     // No need to scan block if it was created before the wallet birthday.
    1472                 :            :     // Uses chain max time and twice the grace period to adjust time for block time variability.
    1473         [ -  + ]:      23806 :     if (block.chain_time_max < m_birth_time.load() - (TIMESTAMP_WINDOW * 2)) return;
    1474                 :            : 
    1475                 :            :     // Scan block
    1476         [ +  + ]:     137668 :     for (size_t index = 0; index < block.data->vtx.size(); index++) {

    1796                 :          0 :         ScanResult result = ScanForWalletTransactions(start_block, start_height, /*max_height=*/{}, reserver, /*fUpdate=*/update, /*save_progress=*/false);

    1805                 :            : 
    1806                 :            : /**
    1807                 :            :  * Scan the block chain (starting in start_block) for transactions
    1808                 :            :  * from or to us. If fUpdate is true, found transactions that already
    1809                 :            :  * exist in the wallet will be updated. If max_height is not set, the
    1810                 :            :  * mempool will be scanned as well.
    1811                 :            :  *
    1812                 :            :  * @param[in] start_block Scan starting block. If block is not on the active
    1813                 :            :  *                        chain, the scan will return SUCCESS immediately.
    1814                 :            :  * @param[in] start_height Height of start_block
    1815                 :            :  * @param[in] max_height  Optional max scanning height. If unset there is
    1816                 :            :  *                        no maximum and scanning can continue to the tip
    1817                 :            :  *
    1818                 :            :  * @return ScanResult returning scan information and indicating success or
    1819                 :            :  *         failure. Return status will be set to SUCCESS if scan was
    1820                 :            :  *         successful. FAILURE if a complete rescan was not possible (due to
    1821                 :            :  *         pruning or corruption). USER_ABORT if the rescan was aborted before
    1822                 :            :  *         it could complete.
    1823                 :            :  *
    1824                 :            :  * @pre Caller needs to make sure start_block (and the optional stop_block) are on
    1825                 :            :  * the main chain after to the addition of any new keys you want to detect
    1826                 :            :  * transactions for.
    1827                 :            :  */

    1970                 :            : 
    1971                 :          0 : bool CWallet::SubmitTxMemoryPoolAndRelay(CWalletTx& wtx, std::string& err_string, bool relay) const
    1972                 :            : {
    1973                 :          0 :     AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet);
    1974                 :            : 
    1975                 :            :     // Can't relay if wallet is not broadcasting
    1976         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!GetBroadcastTransactions()) return false;
    1977                 :            :     // Don't relay abandoned transactions
    1978         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (wtx.isAbandoned()) return false;
    1979                 :            :     // Don't try to submit coinbase transactions. These would fail anyway but would
    1980                 :            :     // cause log spam.
    1981         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (wtx.IsCoinBase()) return false;
    1982                 :            :     // Don't try to submit conflicted or confirmed transactions.
    1983         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (GetTxDepthInMainChain(wtx) != 0) return false;
    1984                 :            : 
    1985                 :            :     // Submit transaction to mempool for relay
    1986         [ #  # ]:          0 :     WalletLogPrintf("Submitting wtx %s to mempool for relay\n", wtx.GetHash().ToString());
    1987                 :            :     // We must set TxStateInMempool here. Even though it will also be set later by the
    1988                 :            :     // entered-mempool callback, if we did not there would be a race where a
    1989                 :            :     // user could call sendmoney in a loop and hit spurious out of funds errors
    1990                 :            :     // because we think that this newly generated transaction's change is
    1991                 :            :     // unavailable as we're not yet aware that it is in the mempool.
    1992                 :            :     //
    1993                 :            :     // If broadcast fails for any reason, trying to set wtx.m_state here would be incorrect.
    1994                 :            :     // If transaction was previously in the mempool, it should be updated when
    1995                 :            :     // TransactionRemovedFromMempool fires.
    1996                 :          0 :     bool ret = chain().broadcastTransaction(wtx.tx, m_default_max_tx_fee, relay, err_string);
    1997         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (ret) wtx.m_state = TxStateInMempool{};
    1998                 :          0 :     return ret;
    1999                 :          0 : }
    2000                 :            : 
    2001                 :          0 : std::set<uint256> CWallet::GetTxConflicts(const CWalletTx& wtx) const
    2002                 :            : {
    2003                 :          0 :     AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet);
    2004                 :            : 
    2005                 :          0 :     const uint256 myHash{wtx.GetHash()};
    2006                 :          0 :     std::set<uint256> result{GetConflicts(myHash)};
    2007         [ #  # ]:          0 :     result.erase(myHash);
    2008                 :          0 :     return result;
    2009         [ #  # ]:          0 : }
    2010                 :            : 
    2011                 :          0 : bool CWallet::ShouldResend() const
    2012                 :            : {
    2013                 :            :     // Don't attempt to resubmit if the wallet is configured to not broadcast
    2014         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!fBroadcastTransactions) return false;
    2015                 :            : 
    2016                 :            :     // During reindex, importing and IBD, old wallet transactions become
    2017                 :            :     // unconfirmed. Don't resend them as that would spam other nodes.
    2018                 :            :     // We only allow forcing mempool submission when not relaying to avoid this spam.
    2019         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!chain().isReadyToBroadcast()) return false;
    2020                 :            : 
    2021                 :            :     // Do this infrequently and randomly to avoid giving away
    2022                 :            :     // that these are our transactions.
    2023         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (NodeClock::now() < m_next_resend) return false;
    2024                 :            : 
    2025                 :          0 :     return true;
    2026                 :          0 : }
    2027                 :            : 
    2028   [ +  -  +  -  :       4930 : NodeClock::time_point CWallet::GetDefaultNextResend() { return FastRandomContext{}.rand_uniform_delay(NodeClock::now() + 12h, 24h); }
          +  -  +  -  +  
                      - ]
    2029                 :            : 
    2030                 :            : // Resubmit transactions from the wallet to the mempool, optionally asking the
    2031                 :            : // mempool to relay them. On startup, we will do this for all unconfirmed
    2032                 :            : // transactions but will not ask the mempool to relay them. We do this on startup
    2033                 :            : // to ensure that our own mempool is aware of our transactions. There
    2034                 :            : // is a privacy side effect here as not broadcasting on startup also means that we won't
    2035                 :            : // inform the world of our wallet's state, particularly if the wallet (or node) is not
    2036                 :            : // yet synced.
    2037                 :            : //
    2038                 :            : // Otherwise this function is called periodically in order to relay our unconfirmed txs.
    2039                 :            : // We do this on a random timer to slightly obfuscate which transactions
    2040                 :            : // come from our wallet.
    2041                 :            : //
    2042                 :            : // TODO: Ideally, we'd only resend transactions that we think should have been
    2043                 :            : // mined in the most recent block. Any transaction that wasn't in the top
    2044                 :            : // blockweight of transactions in the mempool shouldn't have been mined,
    2045                 :            : // and so is probably just sitting in the mempool waiting to be confirmed.
    2046                 :            : // Rebroadcasting does nothing to speed up confirmation and only damages
    2047                 :            : // privacy.
    2048                 :            : //
    2049                 :            : // The `force` option results in all unconfirmed transactions being submitted to
    2050                 :            : // the mempool. This does not necessarily result in those transactions being relayed,
    2051                 :            : // that depends on the `relay` option. Periodic rebroadcast uses the pattern
    2052                 :            : // relay=true force=false, while loading into the mempool
    2053                 :            : // (on start, or after import) uses relay=false force=true.
    2054                 :          0 : void CWallet::ResubmitWalletTransactions(bool relay, bool force)
    2055                 :            : {
    2056                 :            :     // Don't attempt to resubmit if the wallet is configured to not broadcast,
    2057                 :            :     // even if forcing.
    2058         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!fBroadcastTransactions) return;
    2059                 :            : 
    2060                 :          0 :     int submitted_tx_count = 0;
    2061                 :            : 
    2062                 :            :     { // cs_wallet scope
    2063                 :          0 :         LOCK(cs_wallet);
    2064                 :            : 
    2065                 :            :         // First filter for the transactions we want to rebroadcast.
    2066                 :            :         // We use a set with WalletTxOrderComparator so that rebroadcasting occurs in insertion order
    2067                 :          0 :         std::set<CWalletTx*, WalletTxOrderComparator> to_submit;
    2068         [ #  # ]:          0 :         for (auto& [txid, wtx] : mapWallet) {
    2069                 :            :             // Only rebroadcast unconfirmed txs
    2070   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :             if (!wtx.isUnconfirmed()) continue;
    2071                 :            : 
    2072                 :            :             // Attempt to rebroadcast all txes more than 5 minutes older than
    2073                 :            :             // the last block, or all txs if forcing.
    2074   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :             if (!force && wtx.nTimeReceived > m_best_block_time - 5 * 60) continue;
    2075   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :             to_submit.insert(&wtx);
    2076      [ #  #  # ]:          0 :         }
    2077                 :            :         // Now try submitting the transactions to the memory pool and (optionally) relay them.
    2078         [ #  # ]:          0 :         for (auto wtx : to_submit) {
    2079                 :          0 :             std::string unused_err_string;
    2080   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :             if (SubmitTxMemoryPoolAndRelay(*wtx, unused_err_string, relay)) ++submitted_tx_count;
    2081                 :          0 :         }
    2082                 :          0 :     } // cs_wallet
    2083                 :            : 
    2084         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (submitted_tx_count > 0) {
    2085                 :          0 :         WalletLogPrintf("%s: resubmit %u unconfirmed transactions\n", __func__, submitted_tx_count);
    2086                 :          0 :     }
    2087                 :          0 : }
    2088                 :            : 
    2089                 :            : /** @} */ // end of mapWallet
    2090                 :            : 
    2091                 :          0 : void MaybeResendWalletTxs(WalletContext& context)

    2124                 :            : 
    2125                 :          0 : bool CWallet::SignTransaction(CMutableTransaction& tx, const std::map<COutPoint, Coin>& coins, int sighash, std::map<int, bilingual_str>& input_errors) const

    2130                 :            :         // so we can exit early and return true if that happens

    2132                 :          0 :             return true;
    2133                 :            :         }
    2134         [ #  # ]:          0 :     }
    2135                 :            : 
    2136                 :            :     // At this point, one input was not fully signed otherwise we would have exited already
    2137                 :          0 :     return false;
    2138                 :          0 : }
    2139                 :            : 
    2140                 :          0 : TransactionError CWallet::FillPSBT(PartiallySignedTransaction& psbtx, bool& complete, int sighash_type, bool sign, bool bip32derivs, size_t * n_signed, bool finalize) const
    2141                 :            : {
    2142         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (n_signed) {
    2143                 :          0 :         *n_signed = 0;
    2144                 :          0 :     }
    2145                 :          0 :     LOCK(cs_wallet);
    2146                 :            :     // Get all of the previous transactions
    2147         [ #  # ]:          0 :     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < psbtx.tx->vin.size(); ++i) {
    2148                 :          0 :         const CTxIn& txin = psbtx.tx->vin[i];
    2149         [ #  # ]:          0 :         PSBTInput& input = psbtx.inputs.at(i);
    2150                 :            : 
    2151   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         if (PSBTInputSigned(input)) {
    2152                 :          0 :             continue;
    2153                 :            :         }
    2154                 :            : 
    2155                 :            :         // If we have no utxo, grab it from the wallet.
    2156         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (!input.non_witness_utxo) {
    2157         [ #  # ]:          0 :             const uint256& txhash = txin.prevout.hash;
    2158         [ #  # ]:          0 :             const auto it = mapWallet.find(txhash);
    2159         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (it != mapWallet.end()) {
    2160                 :          0 :                 const CWalletTx& wtx = it->second;
    2161                 :            :                 // We only need the non_witness_utxo, which is a superset of the witness_utxo.
    2162                 :            :                 //   The signing code will switch to the smaller witness_utxo if this is ok.
    2163                 :          0 :                 input.non_witness_utxo = wtx.tx;
    2164                 :          0 :             }

    2179                 :          0 :             (*n_signed) += n_signed_this_spkm;

    2184                 :            :

    2189                 :          0 :     }
    2190                 :            : 
    2191                 :          0 :     return TransactionError::OK;

    2194                 :          0 : SigningResult CWallet::SignMessage(const std::string& message, const PKHash& pkhash, std::string& str_sig) const

    2759                 :          0 :     }
    2760         [ #  # ]:          0 : }
    2761                 :            : 
    2762                 :            : /**
    2763                 :            :  * Compute smart timestamp for a transaction being added to the wallet.
    2764                 :            :  *
    2765                 :            :  * Logic:
    2766                 :            :  * - If sending a transaction, assign its timestamp to the current time.
    2767                 :            :  * - If receiving a transaction outside a block, assign its timestamp to the
    2768                 :            :  *   current time.
    2769                 :            :  * - If receiving a transaction during a rescanning process, assign all its
    2770                 :            :  *   (not already known) transactions' timestamps to the block time.
    2771                 :            :  * - If receiving a block with a future timestamp, assign all its (not already
    2772                 :            :  *   known) transactions' timestamps to the current time.
    2773                 :            :  * - If receiving a block with a past timestamp, before the most recent known
    2774                 :            :  *   transaction (that we care about), assign all its (not already known)
    2775                 :            :  *   transactions' timestamps to the same timestamp as that most-recent-known
    2776                 :            :  *   transaction.
    2777                 :            :  * - If receiving a block with a past timestamp, but after the most recent known
    2778                 :            :  *   transaction, assign all its (not already known) transactions' timestamps to
    2779                 :            :  *   the block time.
    2780                 :            :  *
    2781                 :            :  * For more information see CWalletTx::nTimeSmart,
    2782                 :            :  * https://bitcointalk.org/?topic=54527, or
    2783                 :            :  * https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/1393.
    2784                 :            :  */
    2785                 :      84681 : unsigned int CWallet::ComputeTimeSmart(const CWalletTx& wtx, bool rescanning_old_block) const
    2786                 :            : {
    2787                 :      84681 :     std::optional<uint256> block_hash;
    2788         [ +  - ]:     169362 :     if (auto* conf = wtx.state<TxStateConfirmed>()) {
    2789                 :      84681 :         block_hash = conf->confirmed_block_hash;
    2790         [ #  # ]:      84681 :     } else if (auto* conf = wtx.state<TxStateConflicted>()) {
    2791                 :          0 :         block_hash = conf->conflicting_block_hash;
    2792                 :          0 :     }
    2793                 :            : 
    2794                 :      84681 :     unsigned int nTimeSmart = wtx.nTimeReceived;
    2795         [ -  + ]:      84681 :     if (block_hash) {
    2796                 :      84681 :         int64_t blocktime;
    2797                 :      84681 :         int64_t block_max_time;
    2798         [ -  + ]:      84681 :         if (chain().findBlock(*block_hash, FoundBlock().time(blocktime).maxTime(block_max_time))) {
    2799         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (rescanning_old_block) {
    2800                 :          0 :                 nTimeSmart = block_max_time;
    2801                 :          0 :             } else {
    2802                 :          0 :                 int64_t latestNow = wtx.nTimeReceived;
    2803                 :          0 :                 int64_t latestEntry = 0;
    2804                 :            : 
    2805                 :            :                 // Tolerate times up to the last timestamp in the wallet not more than 5 minutes into the future
    2806                 :          0 :                 int64_t latestTolerated = latestNow + 300;
    2807                 :          0 :                 const TxItems& txOrdered = wtxOrdered;
    2808         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 for (auto it = txOrdered.rbegin(); it != txOrdered.rend(); ++it) {
    2809                 :          0 :                     CWalletTx* const pwtx = it->second;
    2810         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (pwtx == &wtx) {
    2811                 :          0 :                         continue;
    2812                 :            :                     }
    2813                 :          0 :                     int64_t nSmartTime;
    2814                 :          0 :                     nSmartTime = pwtx->nTimeSmart;
    2815         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (!nSmartTime) {
    2816                 :          0 :                         nSmartTime = pwtx->nTimeReceived;
    2817                 :          0 :                     }
    2818         [ #  # ]:          0 :                     if (nSmartTime <= latestTolerated) {
    2819                 :          0 :                         latestEntry = nSmartTime;
    2820         [ #  # ]:          0 :                         if (nSmartTime > latestNow) {
    2821                 :          0 :                             latestNow = nSmartTime;
    2822                 :          0 :                         }
    2823                 :          0 :                         break;
    2824                 :            :                     }
    2825      [ #  #  # ]:          0 :                 }
    2826                 :            : 
    2827                 :          0 :                 nTimeSmart = std::max(latestEntry, std::min(blocktime, latestNow));
    2828                 :          0 :             }
    2829                 :          0 :         } else {
    2830   [ +  -  -  + ]:      84681 :             WalletLogPrintf("%s: found %s in block %s not in index\n", __func__, wtx.GetHash().ToString(), block_hash->ToString());
    2831                 :            :         }
    2832                 :      84681 :     }
    2833                 :     169362 :     return nTimeSmart;
    2834                 :      84681 : }

    3179                 :          0 : bool CWallet::AttachChain(const std::shared_ptr<CWallet>& walletInstance, interfaces::Chain& chain, const bool rescan_required, bilingual_str& error, std::vector<bilingual_str>& warnings)

    3181                 :          0 :     LOCK(walletInstance->cs_wallet);
    3182                 :            :     // allow setting the chain if it hasn't been set already but prevent changing it
    3183   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :     assert(!walletInstance->m_chain || walletInstance->m_chain == &chain);

    3185                 :            : 
    3186                 :            :     // Unless allowed, ensure wallet files are not reused across chains:

    3200                 :            :     // Register wallet with validationinterface. It's done before rescan to avoid
    3201                 :            :     // missing block connections between end of rescan and validation subscribing.
    3202                 :            :     // Because of wallet lock being hold, block connection notifications are going to
    3203                 :            :     // be pending on the validation-side until lock release. It's likely to have
    3204                 :            :     // block processing duplicata (if rescan block range overlaps with notification one)
    3205                 :            :     // but we guarantee at least than wallet state is correct after notifications delivery.
    3206                 :            :     // However, chainStateFlushed notifications are ignored until the rescan is finished
    3207                 :            :     // so that in case of a shutdown event, the rescan will be repeated at the next start.
